newsitem.title: FINLAND: Finns not fooled by reported plan to tax boys.
newsitem.headline: Finns not fooled by reported plan to tax boys.

text.p: Finnish radio failed to fool anyone with a report on Tuesday that the government planned a special tax on boys, to cover the extra costs they cause by being boisterous and destructive.
"Last year, we had several responses when we reported that high heels boost intelligence, but so far there have been no phone calls," radio reporter Cay Karlsson told Reuters.
Accoding to the report, boys aged 16-18 years would be subject to the heaviest tax of around $250 annually, "since that is when they go about breaking beer bottles on the streets".
